#!/usr/bin/env python
import sys
sys.path.insert(0, '/testbed')

from django_migration_linter.migration_linter import MigrationLinter
import tempfile

tmp = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(mode='w', delete=False)
tmp.write('test_project/app_add_not_null_column/migrations/0001_create_table.py\n')
tmp.write('unknown\n')
tmp.write('test_project/app_add_not_null_column/migrations/0002_add_new_not_null_field.py\n')
tmp.close()

migration_list = MigrationLinter.read_migrations_list(tmp.name)
expected = [
    ('app_add_not_null_column', '0001_create_table'),
    ('app_add_not_null_column', '0002_add_new_not_null_field'),
]

print('Migrations:', migration_list)
print('Expected:', expected)
print('Match:', migration_list == expected)

if migration_list == expected:
    print('\n✓ Test PASSED - Fix is working correctly!')
else:
    print('\n✗ Test FAILED - Fix is not working!')
    sys.exit(1)

input.content:
#!/usr/bin/env python
"""Test to verify the fix for --include-migration-from argument bug"""
import sys
import os
import tempfile

# Add testbed to path
sys.path.insert(0, '/testbed')

# Test the fix for line 299 in migration_linter.py
from django_migration_linter.migration_linter import MigrationLinter
from django_migration_linter.utils import split_migration_path

print("Testing fix for --include-migration-from argument bug")
print("=" * 70)

# Simulate what was happening before the fix (WRONG):
print("\n1. BEFORE FIX (WRONG - without strip()):")
print("-" * 70)
test_line_with_newline = "test_project/app_add_not_null_column/migrations/0001_create_table.py\n"
print(f"Input line: {repr(test_line_with_newline)}")
print(f"is_migration_file(line) = {MigrationLinter.is_migration_file(test_line_with_newline)}")

# After calling strip() (CORRECT):
print("\n2. AFTER FIX (CORRECT - with strip()):")
print("-" * 70)
test_line_stripped = test_line_with_newline.strip()
print(f"Input line: {repr(test_line_with_newline)}")
print(f"After .strip(): {repr(test_line_stripped)}")
print(f"is_migration_file(line.strip()) = {MigrationLinter.is_migration_file(test_line_stripped)}")

# Test with actual migration file list
print("\n3. Testing read_migrations_list with actual file:")
print("-" * 70)
tmp = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(mode='w', delete=False)
tmp.write("test_project/app_add_not_null_column/migrations/0001_create_table.py\n")
tmp.write("unknown\n")
tmp.write("test_project/app_add_not_null_column/migrations/0002_add_new_not_null_field.py\n")
tmp.close()

try:
    migration_list = MigrationLinter.read_migrations_list(tmp.name)
    expected = [
        ('app_add_not_null_column', '0001_create_table'),
        ('app_add_not_null_column', '0002_add_new_not_null_field'),
    ]

    print(f"Migrations read: {migration_list}")
    print(f"Expected:        {expected}")

    if migration_list == expected:
        print("\n✅ SUCCESS: The fix works correctly!")
        print("\nMigration linter will now properly filter migrations when using")
        print("--include-migration-from argument.")
    else:
        print("\n❌ FAILURE: Migrations don't match expected values.")
        sys.exit(1)
finally:
    os.unlink(tmp.name)

print("\n" + "=" * 70)
print("Fix verified successfully!")

result_preview: File created successfully at: /tmp/test_simple.py
